content: tides of change notes & tips are placed throughout the pattern for your assistance please familiarize yourself with them before starting your project * * - repeat instructions between asterisks as many times as indicated - repeat within repeat repeat us crochet terminology used instructions between brackets as many times as indicated hook size k/6 5mm - repeat within repeat repeat yarn red heart super saver instructions between curly brackets as many times as indicated yardage 4 004 yds/3 661 m = combined stitches to be made in finished size - 87 /221cm next stitch next chain or next group this is written for a 5 color gradient from darkest color to lightest color beginning chain 1 does not count as a stitch throughout colors 1 royal 2 skeins = 728 yds/665 m other longer starting chains will be 2 blue 2 skeins = 728 yds/665 m specified as to what they represent 3 delft blue 2 skeins = 728 yds/665 m 4 light blue 2 skeins = 728 yds/665 m my ravelry group 5 white 3 skeins = 1 092 yds/998 m made of change note at times when making this my facebook cal group project the edge will want to roll up this is made of change cal normal and it happens because a stitch pattern might be too light to hold itself friend me on facebook down this will resolve itself once heavier frank orandle rounds are added on do not try to fix it by changing hook sizes up and down feel free to contact me with any questions i will be happy to help counting stitches is extremely important in all of my patterns i highly extended crochet stitches video tutorial recommend checking every repeat as you can be found here make them page 2 of 11 this pattern is only available for download from ravelry com ©frank orandle tides of change abbreviations & stitches used skip skip space space st s stitch es slip_stitch slip_stitch chain chain single_crochet single_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet ehdc extended half_double_crochet double_crochet double_crochet edc extended double_crochet treble_crochet treble_crochet etr extended treble_crochet dtr treble_crochet edtr extended treble_crochet single_crochet increase single_crochet increase half_double_crochet increase half_double_crochet increase double_crochet increase double_crochet increase treble_crochet increase treble_crochet increase decrease single_crochet two together sc3tog single_crochet three together decrease double_crochet two together dc3tog double_crochet three together dc4tog double_crochet four together tr2tog treble_crochet two together tr3tog treble_crochet three together tr4tog treble_crochet four together tr5tog treble_crochet five together beg-cluster beginning cluster cluster cluster 2dctog in same st or chain cluster-v cluster v cluster chain 1 cluster fpdc front post double_crochet fptr front post treble_crochet page 3 of 11 this pattern is only available for download from ravelry com ©frank orandle tides of change color 1 round 7 note mark any edc as this will be chain 6 join with slip_stitch to form loop where you will join in round 8 round 1 chain 5 counts as 1st treble_crochet & chain 1 *treble_crochet chain 1* round 7 chain 1 single_crochet in same
